intro: Clematis parviloba var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth Clematis, is a deciduous climbing vine native to eastern North America. It features compound leaves with three to five leaflets that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white to pale blue, usually blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained, fertile soil. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is a popular choice for gardeners seeking a low-maintenance, flowering vine.
